creator: alexandj@fortrex.com
text:
I have found that on OpenBSD 3.0 that Apache 1.3.26 will not compile with 
mod_perl and mod_so.  The issue is in mod_so.  If I leave the --enable-module=so 
off of the APACI_ARGS it will make just fine.

I had this issue with 3 separate OpenBSD 3.0 servers.  The error that comes up 
is LD_RUN_PATH not found.

John Alexander

Running the Makefile.PL in mod_perl with the --enable-module=so option would 
result in the error env: LD_RUN_PATH file or directory not found

achieved success by configuring mod_perl into the apache source tree and then 
running the apache ./configure with all the appropriate options.  Apache 1.3.26 
just doesn't want to configure and make from mod_perl for some reason.
